intro: Melissitus brachycarpus, commonly known as the narrow-fruited melissitus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often followed by narrow, winged fruits. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
